title: Vegetable Curry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrots, peas, potatoes, cauliflower)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, sauté until soft, about 5 minutes.
Add curry powder, cumin, and turmeric. Stir for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add diced tomatoes and coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

title: Grilled Chicken Salad
instructions: Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
Brush chicken with 1 tablespoon olive oil and season with Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Grill chicken for 6-7 minutes per side until cooked through (internal temperature of 165°F).
Let chicken rest for 5 minutes, then slice.
In a large bowl, combine salad greens, cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion.
Toss with remaining olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette.
Top salad with sliced grilled chicken and serve.

title: Pasta Primavera
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add garlic and sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add bell pepper, squash, and zucchini. Cook for 5-7 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Add cherry tomatoes and cook for 2 more minutes.
Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to combine.
Stir in Parmesan cheese and basil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Salmon with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix 1 tablespoon olive oil, garlic, and dill.
Brush salmon with the oil mixture and top with lemon slices.
In a separate bowl, toss vegetables with remaining olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Arrange vegetables around the salmon on the baking sheet.
Bake for 18-20 minutes until salmon is cooked through and vegetables are tender.
Serve immediately.

title: Quinoa Bowl with Roasted Vegetables
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Cook quinoa in vegetable broth according to package directions.
Toss sweet potato, bell pepper, zucchini, and red onion with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes until tender and slightly caramelized.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, garlic, water, salt, and pepper to make the dressing.
Divide quinoa between bowls, top with roasted vegetables.
Drizzle with tahini dressing and garnish with fresh parsley.

title: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breast, cut into strips
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add chicken and stir-fry until no longer pink, about 5-6 minutes. Remove from wok.
Add remaining oil to the wok. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add bell pepper, snow peas, and carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil.
Return chicken to the wok, add sauce mixture, and toss to coat.
Cook for 1-2 minutes until everything is heated through.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.

title: Mediterranean Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 2 cans (15 oz each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
1/2 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and halved
instructions: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, olives, feta cheese, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

title: Beef and Broccoli
ingredients: 1 lb flank steak, thinly sliced against the grain
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, cornstarch, water, and sesame oil. Set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add beef and stir-fry until browned, about 3-4 minutes. Remove from skillet.
Add remaining oil to the skillet. Add garlic and ginger, stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add broccoli and bell pepper. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until vegetables are tender-crisp.
Return beef to the skillet, add sauce mixture, and toss to coat.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until sauce thickens.
Garnish with green onions before serving.

title: Lentil Soup
ingredients: 2 cups green or brown lentils, rinsed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, carrots, and celery. Sauté until vegetables are soft, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic, cumin, thyme, and bay leaf. Cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, and diced tomatoes. Bring to a boil.
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 25-30 minutes until lentils are tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes.
Remove bay leaf. Stir in lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

title: Berry Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: 1 cup mixed frozen berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries)
Toppings: sliced fresh fruit, granola, chia seeds, coconut flakes, nuts
instructions: In a blender, combine frozen banana, frozen berries, Greek yogurt, almond milk, and sweetener if using.
Blend until smooth and thick. Add more almond milk if needed, but keep it thick enough to eat with a spoon.
Pour into a bowl.
Top with sliced fresh fruit, granola, chia seeds, coconut flakes, and nuts.
Serve immediately.
